citations.narrative:
* Two outdoor enclosures have compact earth flooring. One of these enclosures was located outside housing two adult
dogs and the other inside a large shed housing seven puppies. The dogs are digging two large holes underneath their
dog house in one enclosure. One of these large holes had paneling to prevent digging that was exposing sharp points.
Puppy's enclosure had three holes being dug under the side wall and and under the chain link fencing for the enclosure.
These holes were anywhere from approximately 1/2 ' wide to 2 ' long. The maintaining the repair of dug holes in the
compact earth near the fencing, building side wall and dog house indicates these enclosures are not being kept in good
repair. This can allow for the dogs to escape or get injured while trying to escape.
For the prevention of injury to the two adult dogs and seven puppies, all housing facilities must be kept in good repair.
To be corrected by, 25-August-2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
* Three outdoor enclosures, all housing three adult dogs and seven puppies, have compact earth floors. Two of these
enclosures were located inside a large shed. All these enclosures had an accumulation of fecal waste on the compact
earth floors. One enclosure had panel used to prevent the dogs from digging out that had an accumulation of fecal waste
within the panel openings. The waste was brown to grey in color and dry indicating the excrement is not being removed
from the enclosures daily. This can increase the disease hazards, insect and pest infestation.
For the prevention of an accumulation of fecal waste, disease hazards and the reduction of insects and pests, all primary
enclosure's must have daily removal of fecal and food waste.
To be corrected by, 21-August-2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
* An outdoor enclosure, housing two adults dogs, has large weeds growing inside the enclosure. These weeds are
approximately 1' to 3' tall.
Four enclosures inside the large shed all housing, three adult dogs and seven puppies, have an accumulation of item(s)
on the ground around their enclosures.
These item(s) are electrical cord, hoses, two 12V batteries, plastic bags, equipment and bags full of material. This can
attract and provide breeding areas for rodents, and pests and vermin. This does not facilitate cleaning of the premises.
Potentially, this can affect the health and well-being of the dogs.
For the protection of the health and well-being of the dogs, weeds must be controlled to facilitate cleaning. Similarly, all
premises must be free of equipment, batteries, plastic and other discard matter, therefore preventing breeding and living
areas for rodents, and other pests and vermin.
to be corrected by, 28-August-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* Two outdoor enclosures have compact earth flooring. One of these enclosures was located outside housing two adult 
dogs and the other inside a large shed housing seven puppies. The dogs are digging two large holes underneath their 
dog house in one enclosure. One of these large holes had paneling to prevent digging that was exposing sharp points. 
Puppy's enclosure had three holes being dug under the side wall and and under the chain link fencing for the enclosure. 
These holes were anywhere from approximately 1/2 ' wide to 2 ' long. The maintaining the repair of dug holes in the 
compact earth near the fencing, building side wall and dog house indicates these enclosures are not being kept in good 
repair. This can allow for the dogs to escape or get injured while trying to escape. 
 
For the prevention of injury to the two adult dogs and seven puppies, all housing facilities must be kept in good repair.  
 
To be corrected by, 25-August-2023. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
* Three outdoor enclosures, all housing three adult dogs and seven puppies, have compact earth floors. Two of these 
enclosures were located inside a large shed. All these enclosures had an accumulation of fecal waste on the compact 
earth floors. One enclosure had panel used to prevent the dogs from digging out that had an accumulation of fecal waste 
within the panel openings. The waste was brown to grey in color and dry indicating the excrement is not being removed 
from the enclosures daily. This can increase the disease hazards, insect and pest infestation.  
 
For the prevention of an accumulation of fecal waste, disease hazards and the reduction of insects and pests, all primary 
enclosure's must have daily removal of fecal and food waste.  
 
To be corrected by, 21-August-2023. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.

* An outdoor enclosure, housing two adults dogs, has large weeds growing inside the enclosure. These weeds are 
approximately 1' to 3' tall. 
Four enclosures inside the large shed all housing, three adult dogs and seven puppies, have an accumulation of item(s) 
on the ground around their enclosures.  
These item(s) are electrical cord, hoses, two 12V batteries, plastic bags, equipment and bags full of material. This can 
attract and provide breeding areas for rodents, and pests and vermin. This does not facilitate cleaning of the premises. 
Potentially, this can affect the health and well-being of the dogs.  
 
For the protection of the health and well-being of the dogs, weeds must be controlled to facilitate cleaning. Similarly, all 
premises must be free of equipment, batteries, plastic and other discard matter, therefore preventing breeding and living 
areas for rodents, and other pests and vermin.  
 
to be corrected by, 28-August-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
